examples: The museum curator said that the sword originated from the Yamato period in Japan.

definitions.definition: Any of several towns in Japan; see Wikipedia .
The imperial house which formerly ruled Japan from the province of Yamato; by extension, the dominant native ethnic group in Japan .
examples: In Japanese society, Koreans are viewed as being of a lower rung on the social ladder compared to Yamato people.

definitions.definition: A male given name from Japanese .

secondary_definitions: Any of several towns in Japan; see Wikipedia .
The imperial house which formerly ruled Japan from the province of Yamato; by extension, the dominant native ethnic group in Japan .
A male given name from Japanese .

definitions.definition: A member of the Yamato court which formerly ruled Japan.
A member of an ethnic group of Japan, the predominant ethnic group of the islands.
One of a class of battleships used by the Imperial Japanese Navy during the Second World War.

main_definition: A member of the Yamato court which formerly ruled Japan.

One of a class of battleships used by the Imperial Japanese Navy during the Second World War.
